parameters: Fade out the screen and show the black bars for the cinematic effect.
Since we aren't using the player, we're going to need to halt
his movement and prevent menu opening, to do this we can simply
use a switch. Without this happening, the player can click to
move the player which will reveal the box-clicky thing
switch to stop movement and prevent opening menu
Change the blank events to mimick our party, set their location, and
make our current party hidden. Uncheck "wait for completion" in set movement
change screens tint and start a screen scroll, then fade in
First, we'll tint it all the way black to make the smooth
Now we fade in the screen to the desired color for 120 frames, or 2 seconds
Move the new party to the left, just before the baddy jumps down
and stops them. Uncheck wait for completion once again and estimate
or playtest to find out how many frames you'll need to wait before
the next action. We want harold to face Therese before she's done moving.
This can also be done in set move rout for harold, but either way works
For therese's last step, we're going to make her walk a bit
We start the dialogue. Make sure the window is transparent, and
you only use the 2 bottom lines of text. We're going to use show
picture to slide in the emotes
-- Start the picture at 734 x and 530 y
Slide it to 730 x and 530 y for about 20 frames, don't wait for
I’m good Cedric. Were you looking for me? \|\|\^
Your ‘husband’ said I should stay with you. He didn’t want me in his presence. \|\|\^
He hasn’t gotten over his father’s death. He keeps telling me about what - \|\|\^
- what a great person he was before his illness took place. It kind of - \|\|\^
- reminded me of the times before Father left for Randaltown. \|\|\^
Yes, they were such good times. I still can’t believe Mother and Father are gone. \|\|\^
Me too. Sometimes I feel guilty. \|\|\^
You shouldn’t feel like that. It was out of your control Idelle. \|\|\^
That’s true. I have to say I’m surprised you made it this far, I guess you - \|\|\^
- really are stronger than you look. \|\|\^
I don’t get why you, Richard and Leya… Leya?! Have you found her? \|\|\^
No, I haven’t been able to locate her body. It gives me hope. \|\|\^
I wanted to ask you a favour? \|\|\^
Well since Dormato became King, people have been talking. They believe - \|\|\^
- that it was a plot to get King Luther killed. They aren’t in favour - \|\|\^
- of me either. I need you to spread the good news of Dormato and I to the - \|\|\^
- the people of Luthania. Could you do that? \|\|\^
Yes, I could I guess. Do you have a list of people to talk to? \|\|\^
Fade out the screen and show the black bars for the cinematic effect.
Since we aren't using the player, we're going to need to halt
his movement and prevent menu opening, to do this we can simply
use a switch. Without this happening, the player can click to
move the player which will reveal the box-clicky thing
switch to stop movement and prevent opening menu
Change the blank events to mimick our party, set their location, and
make our current party hidden. Uncheck "wait for completion" in set movement
change screens tint and start a screen scroll, then fade in
First, we'll tint it all the way black to make the smooth
Now we fade in the screen to the desired color for 120 frames, or 2 seconds
Move the new party to the left, just before the baddy jumps down
and stops them. Uncheck wait for completion once again and estimate
or playtest to find out how many frames you'll need to wait before
the next action. We want harold to face Therese before she's done moving.
This can also be done in set move rout for harold, but either way works
For therese's last step, we're going to make her walk a bit
We start the dialogue. Make sure the window is transparent, and
you only use the 2 bottom lines of text. We're going to use show
picture to slide in the emotes
-- Start the picture at 734 x and 530 y
Slide it to 730 x and 530 y for about 20 frames, don't wait for
If you’re here to tell me she’s right, I don’t want to hear it. \|\|\^
Well, she is kind of right. \|\|\^
Of course, you’d agree with her. You’ve always gone against what I’ve said. \|\|\^
That’s not true Idelle. But she is right what I went and did in the towns won’t - \|\|\^
- last for long. We need to find a more permanent solution. Queen Rosa was - \|\|\^
- talking about having to make difficult decisions. She said as a queen you - \|\|\^
I am aware of the decisions I will have to make. It’s not easy though. - \|\|\^
- It’s funny how I always wanted to be a queen only to find out it’s - \|\|\^
- nothing like I thought it was. \|\|\^
If anyone can handle the responsibility of being queen it’s you. You just - \|\|\^
- need thicker skin and a tougher stomach. \|\|\^
But back to the task at hand. You need to work on Dormato and fix your - \|\|\^
I am trying so hard with Dormato it’s exhausting sometimes. He won’t do - \|\|\^
- anything. I have no doubt that he loves me he certainly shows it. - \|\|\^
- But when he walks out of the room he becomes a different person. - \|\|\^
- He seems sad and alone and I don’t know what to do. As for his mother, I - \|\|\^
- don’t know if I can do that she makes it so difficult. The constant snooping - \|\|\^
Well, you will have to fix it, our family needs this. Just keep trying with - \|\|\^
- Dormato, give him a reason to go out and rule. I know he has an issue - \|\|\^
- but you can help fix it. \|\|\^
Lord Cedric, the King requests your presence in the Throne Room. \|\|\^
I guess I will be on my way then. We shouldn’t keep the king waiting. \|\|\^
